meanings.definition: A tooth with a broad crown used for grinding food
meanings.sent1: My dentist said I need to brush my molar more carefully to avoid cavities.
meanings.sent2: I can feel a piece of popcorn stuck in my molar.
meanings.sent3: I tried to eat the whole apple in one bite, but my molar said no way!
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like the chomping of a giant molar, loud and infectious.
meanings.sent5: The molar's job is to crush and grind food into smaller pieces for digestion.

meanings.definition: A unit of measurement for the amount of a substance
meanings.sent1: The recipe called for one molar of sugar, but I only had half.
meanings.sent2: The chemist measured the molar concentration of the solution.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally added a molar of salt instead of sugar to the cookies!
meanings.sent4: The molar of water in the tank was just enough to last the journey.
meanings.sent5: The molar of medicine prescribed by the doctor was too bitter to swallow.

meanings.definition: Relating to the molar teeth or the molars in general
meanings.sent1: The molar tooth at the back of my mouth is hurting.
meanings.sent2: The dentist recommended a special toothpaste for molar care.
meanings.sent3: His molar grin showed off his shiny braces.
meanings.sent4: The molar strength of his bite surprised everyone at the table.
meanings.sent5: The molar shape of the rock resembled a giant tooth in the ground.
